title: Blended Learning Strategies for Analyzing MOOC Learner Diversity and Behavior at Scale

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental online learning experience and foundational mathematical knowledge
context.additional_context: For corporate managers/leaders: analyzing MOOC learner characteristics and exploring blended learning implementation strategies

learning_goals: Three or more cultural and demographic diversity factors of MOOC learners can be explained.

Within one week, learners must analyze behavioral data (progress rate, engagement) of 10 corporate learners, identify ≥3 personalized learning patterns (e.g., weekend-intensive, evening-focused, irregular) with ≥80% accuracy, and propose ≥2 customized learning strategies (e.g., weekly review reminders, peak learning time recommendations) in a formal proposal.

Learners must identify three types of blended learning preferences (e.g., blended-preference, flexibility-seeking) among corporate learners aged ≥40, design customized support systems (learning materials, feedback frequency, tech tools) for each type within one week, and submit an implementation plan meeting ≥4 of 5 checklist items.
Two or more learner retention strategies applicable to mathematics MOOC content can be suggested.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
